=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Grease 2
Review Date: 2012/09/18
Store: Michelle Pfeiffer  (Actor),     Maxwell Caulfield  (Actor),     Patricia Birch  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts, Musicals
Product Description: ['The sequel to the 1978 hit movie, GREASE 2 is set in the early 1960\x92s when a new British student, Michael Carrington (Caulfield), rides into town and joins the ranks at Rydell High. A book nerd who immediately falls for the blonde bombshell leader of the Pink Ladies, Stephanie Zinone (Pfeiffer), Michael finds himself smitten, but out of his element. Knowing that the Pink Ladies are the hippest clique of chicks at Rydell, who only date their equals in coolness - the T-Birds, Michael sets out to turn from a geek to a greaser to see if he can win the gorgeous Stephanie\x92s heart.']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Musicals, Romance', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Maureen Teefy, Leif Green, Didi Conn, Alison Price, Eve Arden, Lorna Luft, Pamela Adlon, Michelle Pfeiffer, Patricia Birch, Ken Finkleman, Maxwell Caulfield, Peter Frechette, Adrian Zmed, Christopher McDonaldMaureen Teefy, Leif Green, Didi Conn, Alison Price, Eve Arden, Lorna Luft, Pamela Adlon, Michelle Pfeiffer, Patricia Birch, Ken Finkleman, Maxwell Caulfield, Peter Frechette, Adrian Zmed, Christopher McDonald  See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.75 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Patricia Birch', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 55 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 10, 2003', 'Actors': 'Michelle Pfeiffer, Maxwell Caulfield, Lorna Luft, Maureen Teefy, Alison Price', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Ken Finkleman', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: I did not see the movie yet but my 9 yera old daughter stated, "it needs a little work!"  This is from a 9 yr old who loves the movie Greesand has watched it over 12 time, so I did not expect it to get good reviews!  lol
Review Title: Review from my 9 yr old daughter
Rating: 3.0

Movies & TV, Musicals & Performing Arts, Musicals
['The sequel to the 1978 hit movie, GREASE 2 is set in the early 1960\x92s when a new British student, Michael Carrington (Caulfield), rides into town and joins the ranks at Rydell High. A book nerd who immediately falls for the blonde bombshell leader of the Pink Ladies, Stephanie Zinone (Pfeiffer), Michael finds himself smitten, but out of his element. Knowing that the Pink Ladies are the hippest clique of chicks at Rydell, who only date their equals in coolness - the T-Birds, Michael sets out to turn from a geek to a greaser to see if he can win the gorgeous Stephanie\x92s heart.']

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

This user displays a notable interest in musicals and family-friendly films, specifically those that resonate with younger audiences. Their interaction suggests a penchant for nostalgia, as indicated by their engagement with a sequel to a well-known classic. They prioritize entertainment value for their child, reflecting a significant focus on family viewing experiences. The user's review, notably written from their child's perspective, highlights their openness to feedback from younger viewers, indicating a collaborative approach to movie selection.

Additionally, the user maintains a playful attitude, evident in their humorous comment about the child’s critique. This suggests a light-hearted approach to media consumption and family interactions. The user seems to appreciate films that provide a blend of romance and fun, characteristic of musical genres. Overall, they value content that is suitable for children while also remaining engaging and entertaining for adults, suggesting a trend towards inclusive family activities.
